website_summaries.verdict: Though not as rugged as pricier pumps, it does the trick for most water-removal jobs without breaking the bank.
pros: Offers similar water-removing action as higher-priced models made possible by its 1/3-horsepower motor
Has a 10-foot cord and garden hose adapter
cons: Gets a little sluggish with some tasks that require quick removal of excessive water

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Bought this to empty my hottub every 4 months for cleaning. 440 gallon hottub was emptied in about 30 minutes. Not noisy. Came with garden hose adapter so it was plug and play for me.
customer_reviews.author: nomiketyson

customer_reviews.title: Impressive!
customer_reviews.text: Our pool requires partial draining and refilling a couple times a year due to increasing stabilizer levels, renting a pump is a process so we decided to give this one a go- especially since it actually cost less to purchase then to rent! In 3 hours it drained 18" of water- probably close to 5000 gallons. We used the U.S Pool Supply brand 1 1/2" x 50' hose found here on Amazon, I'm sure it would be a much longer process with a garden hose. We had hoped to purchase the 1/3 hp version but that one wouldn't ship for 1-2 months, so we went with this 1/4 hp model. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kforti1

customer_reviews.title: Using it to do water changes on my aquariums it does great. Now the cons
customer_reviews.text: Let me start off by saying that this pump really moves some water. Using it to do water changes on my aquariums it does great. Now the cons. This is the second pump I have got, the first just died and would not work at all. The second pump after using it twice for a max of 20 to 30 minutes has started over heating and shutting off. I would choose another brand that is more reliable than take a chance on these faulty pumps. I know I will not buy another one of these or recommend them to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Kim T.

customer_reviews.title: Wins against hurricane Matthew!
customer_reviews.text: Getting us through hurricane Matthew southeast of Raleigh, NC, as the basement sump pump couldn't keep up with hours of 6" per hour rainfall. Deployed the pump and have been lowering the water 1" per hour with about a 10' lift (1200 gal/hr). Generator standing by just in case but this little guy saved the furnace and hot water heater!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Warren

customer_reviews.title: Little pump than can!
customer_reviews.text: Great little pump! I have a ditch that fills up about 4 times a year after we get about 3" of rain (anything less and no problem) that I wanted to drain to keep from killing the grass and Bought this to drain it..Have had it 2 years now and it works flawlessly..super quiet and effective...The before and after picts are 4 hours apart and there was a lot of water there!
customer_reviews.author: BubbaBoy

customer_reviews.title: WORKED GREAT ONCE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pump last summer 2018 for a back up for my Moms basement which floods on occasion. Used it for the first time couple of days ago and it worked great. Pumped the water out in no time at all. I did not leave it unattended, when It was done I unplugged it. Was happy with this product it was on basement concrete floors very little mud or debri. The next day I went to use it again and all it does is hum. I checked to make sure the the screen was not plugged up or that the air vent was not plugged, those were OK. great product for 1 time use.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: HOW BAD THIS Pump is really made
customer_reviews.text: Bought this pump on Jan. 6th 2019 and in March 13th it exploded in my fish pond. The whole base of the pump came out of the housing needless to say that oil got all over the water and my fish died. The price of the pump is right but the pump need work, I suggest anyone that loves their fish like I do, buy a different pump until someone does something about this.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Dos Santos

customer_reviews.title: Not so Superior. This Pump CANNOT run continuously
customer_reviews.text: I ran this pump for three days continuously in a recirculating (Hydroponic) system; the water level always remained covering the housing of the pump. After unplugging the pump (still working and pumping) it refused to start. If it had overheated the thermal switch protection built into the pump would or should have prevented it from damage. The pump was running when I unplugged it, submerged in water, yet refused to start after re-plugging it. The pump is also Made in China. I will not by this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Richards

customer_reviews.title: Very Short Life Span
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in March 2018 for a "stand by" pump to use when needed. September 2018 had to use it to drain pool. Worked great for about 10 hours then started tripping the ground fault. Reset breaker & it would run maybe an hour then trip the breaker again. I thought maybe the breaker was getting weak so tried to plug the pump into a regular outlet & immediately it tripped that breaker. Bought a new pump different mfg. & plugged it into same ground fault, pump is working great. Conclusion the superior pump is not so superior. Going to call their support & see if they will honor their 1 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Russ F. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Oil will eventually leak out of this pump
customer_reviews.text: Just a word of warning about this pump. While it works great and seems durable, it has an oil filled motor. I've had the pump for roughly 7 months and on month 6 the oil began to leak out of the pump into the water. As I'm using it with potable water this was bad. Either way, I'm surprised after such a short amount of time that this pump was already leaking oil. Buyer beware if you want to purchase this for anything other than pumping waste water.
customer_reviews.author: Aggro Sky

customer_reviews.title: Died an early death
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Feb 2018. Used 3 times, about 2-3 hours at a time, submerged in pool, never run dry or hot. Pulling up only about 2 feet vertical to a 50 foot horizontal run. Jan 2019, 4th attempt at using, keeps popping breakers or GFCI outlets. 3 uses == dead. Popping the breaker indicates it's not a motor that just died, but something inside has worn so rapidly that it's shorting directly to ground, with less than 10 hours of run time.
customer_reviews.author: aj r

customer_reviews.title: Great for de-scaling tankess water heater
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for DIY de-scaling of my tankless water heater. Followed the Rinnia directions and used 4 gallons of regular white vinegar in a 5 gallon bucket, and circulated for an hour. Some have suggested that, since it is designed for water, it won't hold up pumping vinegar. But, using it only once or twice a year for an hour, and then thoroughly rinsing the unit with fresh water, I am betting on getting several years of service which will save me a bundle over hiring a plumber to perform this very simple DIY task!
customer_reviews.author: mcs79

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 6 weeks!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to water my plants around the house using a timer and a water barrel. After about 6 weeks of use it just shuts down after 20 to 25 seconds by tripping my breaker. I have tried different outlets and still the same results. I have contacted Superior's customer service and awaiting a reply.
customer_reviews.author: CJR

customer_reviews.title: Vinegar pump for tankless water heater cleaning
customer_reviews.text: I used this pump (1/5 hp) to clean my tankless water heater. Seemed to do the job nicely. No reason to buy the $130+ kits. Just buy this pump, some hoses (I bought the 10ft set: Whirlpool 8212656RP), and buy a 5 gallon bucket. I added teflon tape to the pump fitting just to be sure, it's a few dollars. At most it's $80 worth of components. Hook it all up, fill bucket with 2-3 gallons of vinegar, let it run for an hour, dump out the vinegar, and flush the pump and hoses with water. The worst part is storing it all for 6-12 months till it's needed again.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Amazon Buyer

customer_reviews.title: I guess I'll join the thousands of others that loved this pump
customer_reviews.text: I guess I'll join the thousands of others that loved this pump............I use it to drain an in-ground fountain basin that's about 120 gallons (totally disgusting in there because of the birds and everything else that washes down) and nothing stops this pump - and it's fast. And it really does drain down to 1/4-inch depth. I used to do this with a big bucket, when I was energetic and stupid, but now the process is fast enough I'll clean the basin much more often. Mighty handy to have around, gotta tell ya, and it's a very high-quality unit. Very pleased, and it was delivered the next day.
customer_reviews.author: steve in San Diego

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Item when it runs works well. The issue is when I turn it on it needs to be moved up and down vigorously in the water to get the pump moving water and then it will turn off by itself defeating the purpose of having a pump. Definitely disappointed as we are having a very wet season here and I am constantly fussing with the pump to get it to work correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Pascualg805

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but flawed.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well to do a seasonal half drain of my pool. Pumped for about a day and a half. Only issue is when I took it out and set it out in the sun to dry, the screw holding the carrying handle is very rusted. There should be no type of metal that rusts used on something that's obviously made to be in water.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Notestine

customer_reviews.title: Too Expensive & Lower Capacity Than Advertised :
customer_reviews.text: Effective Pump, but it clearly Does Not Pump at a Rate Of 3300 Gallons Per Hour in 1 Foot of water as stated in the Specs. I would estimate it does a Maximum of 1500 Gallons Per Hour at a Depth of 1 Foot. The Pump also has a few screws that should be Stainless Steel, but since they are not, they Rust very quickly. This is an Ok Pump for draining my Pool or similar Casual use where speed is not important, but would not trust as a Basement Sump Pump. It does not have Capacity or Speed to drive a large number of gallons per hour.
customer_reviews.author: WD

customer_reviews.title: Needs work
customer_reviews.text: The pump itself appears to work fine, it's the cord I have a problem with. Any area of water requiring a pump to drain is not going to be within 10 feet of an electrical outlet. I had to spend another $10 for an extension cord, and now have to be very careful to assure it doesn't end up in the water. I also looked at your pump with the float shut off, it looks very flimsy and it appears to me it could be very easily damaged. Poor designs.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky S

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly for purging tankless hot water heater
customer_reviews.text: The unit was very easy to use and was surprisingly quiet. Made purging our hot water heater a breeze. It has a bypass feature that ensured the unit worked well when there was restricted flow during the initial purging of the system. Ensure you have sufficient liquid around the pump because will overheat otherwise. I can't rate longevity is I only used it for 3 hours to purge my hot water system; however, my view of the construction is it should last me for years.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Worsham

customer_reviews.title: it may be fine for you
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the bilge pump in my boat leaves quite a bit of water in the bilge (the boat is a small trawler). This was described as going down to about 1/4 or 1/2 inch, so I thought it would take more out. It does not. When the water is that low, it does not pump it out. If you are looking to pump out more water than that, it may be fine for you, but I had that in mind....maybe no pump will go down that far, I don't know. It is just a lot of work to use towels and wring them out for such a large area. This is not the solution for shallow water.
customer_reviews.author: Escapeartist13

customer_reviews.title: pump was used for a total of about 10 hrs and it caused electrical circuit breaker to trip.
customer_reviews.text: I think I have bad luck with the pump that I bought. I bought it to descale my tankless water heater. i bought it in June 2018. I descale my tankless water heater twice a year. Say I did it twice in 2018, 2019 and once in 2020. That's a total of 5 times and about 2 hrs each time. That's a total of not close to 10 hrs as the last time I used it, the pump caused by electrical circuit breaker to trip at around 90 minutes. Could be my bad luck but I need a replacement for it. I will try to buy from a different manufacturer to see if the longevity is better.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful pump
customer_reviews.text: I use these to pump water from a creek to a garden for irrigation. Even though the pump is not designed for this type of use, it does wonderful. I average around 3 - 5 years per pump. The water is pumped close to 100 yards from the creek to the garden. After trying various utility pumps from local hardware stores, this is the best one I have found. A similar pump costing twice as much from a nation wide chain store last around a month, while I get 3 - 5 years with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: One annoying defect
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product save for a defective usage protocol. (1) it won't run dry so you can't leave it running. (2) if you want to pump out the 1" of water that seeped into the basement, you have to stand in water to turn it on as it has no on/off switch and not enough cord. You have to plug it in to turn it on. (3) You can't use an extension cord. My solution has been to buy a IOT wifi switch, but that doesn't like to work in the basement because the signal is low. I am sure it is very useful to some people but not so much for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, excellent water flow
customer_reviews.text: I used this pump (1/2 HP version) with the garden hose adapter to empty a large (500+-gallon) inflatable kiddie pool (no chemicals), and water all the plants around the house. Worked great, sucked the water down to well under 1 inch. It took nearly an hour, but I'm certain it would have been a fraction of that time if using a full-size 1 1/2" hose, rather than a puny garden hose which (by my calculations) has about 17% of the capacity of a 1 1/2" hose.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey J. Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Good option for flushing a tankless heater
customer_reviews.text: Used this to flush my Rinnai tankless heater, didn't realize the flush is needed every 12 - 18 months until I was watching random youtube videos. I bought 4 gallons of white vinegar from the grocery store and reused a 5 gallon bucket I have at home, after this was delivered I realized I also need pipes, luckily I was able to use the hot water and cold water pipes of my washer. After 1 hour of flushing I don't see any signs of erosion on the pump, I could definitely reuse it next year.
customer_reviews.author: Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Great pump to flush a tankless water heater.
customer_reviews.text: Great pump to flush clean a tankless water heater. Got this to flush my Rinnai water heater. Flushed with 2 gallons of vinegar for 60 minutes. Pump handled it very well. Did not get too hot or vibrate much or no loud noise. I got a food grade 5 gallon bucket from HD, 2 gallons of white vinegar from Costco and color coded washing machine pipes from Amazon. Watched a couple of videos on YouTube and flushed my tankless without issues.
customer_reviews.author: S. Dhruva

customer_reviews.title: Only last for 2 months...
customer_reviews.text: I am using this little pump formy water fountain for the past 2 months, and running an average 8 hours per day, but there is oil leaking from inside. I still have it running, but I am not sure when it going to break down. Before I replace SuperiorPump, I had Little Giant water pump, and it had lasted for almost 2 year with an average for 11 hours running time per day, before it failed. Now it make me to though all the positive reviews for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tequila358

customer_reviews.title: Works great for pool cover
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pump to remove water from the top of my above ground pool cover and it did the job! I connected a 120ft garden hose to the pump in order to direct the water away from my backyard and it took about 2 hours total to get remove all of the water (water was not removed at all during the winter). I had to remove leaves and debris from the bottom of the pump numerous times to prevent clogging. Can’t speak to longevity yet, but I can tell you this pump was quiet and pretty efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Lou B.

customer_reviews.title: Pumps my Basement to an acceptable level
customer_reviews.text: During the rainy season, my basement floods. I use two of these little pumps to keep the water from damaging my heat & air system. I place them on the basement floor in little screen wire baskets to keep large trash out of them. I turn them on and off manually. They pump the water down to about 1/4 inch or so. I haven't actually measured it, but it's low enough for my purposes. This year I've bought one that is supposed to turn itself on & off automatically. Haven't tried it yet. These little pumps last a couple to several years before I have to replace one. I keep a couple of spares on hand at all times.
customer_reviews.author: CountryBoy

customer_reviews.title: If you want to set up a sump pump type of arrangement you also need a float switch.
customer_reviews.text: Much of the year in southern Arizona we tout a "dry heat". Not so during the monsoon season in July, August & September. Our mini split air conditioner has three evaporators (air handlers). We would collect nearly three gallons of condensate daily. There was no way to drain it directly outside, so I bought the pump and a float switch and put it all in a 5 gallon bucket. The unit comes with a hose bib adapter so I used a 3/4" garden hose along the workshop floor where the condensation drains from the three air handlers. Routed it to a place where I drilled a hole in our shed so the hose terminated outside. It works great.
customer_reviews.author: Tucson John

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend for average homeowner
customer_reviews.text: Used this to empty a 7500 gallon above ground pool that had an algae bloom that was ruining our summer, came with a adapter that fit the average garden hose. While it took over a day to pump it all out I was expecting that being all the water was being pumped through a garden hose. A few times we had to clear some leaves or debris off the bottom because this doesn’t grind up debris like much more pricey professional pump like a plumber would have but I also knew this. I should have bought this sooner because it really saved the summer.
customer_reviews.author: DesignsByNicolette

customer_reviews.title: Strong and powerful pump!
customer_reviews.text: This pump is great! We used to have one from Home Depot that was an Flotec and cost $115, but they no longer carry this type of pump so we checked Amazon and sure enough we found this at less than 1/2 price we have paid in the past. In addition this pump is very powerful with unbelievable suction, drained an in ground swimming pool in about 30 minutes! We highly recommend this pump to anyone that need to do this type of thing. To refill our pool we put the pump down the hill into our stream and pumped it uphill at about 45 degree slope 50' and it worked great better than the Flotec. What a deal.
customer_reviews.author: GLORIA SAWREY

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Pump! Easy to operate.
customer_reviews.text: Feels like a solidly built pump. Very easy to operate. I put it in a large flower pot filled with water and the thing purged the bucket off the water in under a minute. I don't think asking a rating for longevity is a fair question because I don't know how long it's going to last . I plan to install it in our rain barrel to power our drip irrigation system, but I feel the pump is got more power than may need to extend the irrigation system to farm out all that power. Overall, looks and feels solid, easy to operate out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: TimeTravellerTop Contributor: Raspberry Pi

customer_reviews.title: Works great to pump out kiddie pool
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it to pump out kiddie pool on our deck (about 1000 gallons) and it works really well. I didn't time but it takes about 10 minutes or less. Attaches straight to a garden hose and is very quiet. It is able to pump down to a very low level of water where I can just tip the pool and dump the rest. I also has a mesh guard to keep any floating stuff from getting into the pump. Really helped me change the water more frequently to keep it nice and clean. Very happy with this pump and it might have some other utility use down the road but my main intention was to maintain kiddie pool.
customer_reviews.author: K. Beliakov

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and powerful.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to drain out our above ground intex swimming pool. The pool is 12 feet wide and roughly 4 feet deep. This pump drained most of the water in about 6hrs, roughly 3000gallons. The pump was very quiet, when in the water you couldn't even hear it. I had the pump connected to about 25 feet worth of garden hose and it pumped just fine. Only concern is the legs it stands on are pretty small plastic pins, i fear it could puncture the vinyl though as of now it has now. Overall works good, I would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: bradams115

customer_reviews.title: Working but less than a week, already rusted screw
customer_reviews.text: It's working as designed which is good and made my watering the plants super easy... but I had this only less than a week and had been in water about 4 days. It already had rust around one of the screws. Very disappointing and it's difficult to trust a product and manufacturer when the item is supposed to be under water and the manufacturer did not have plate that would hold up under water. Truly very disappointing. Update: We were going to return the item but my hubby decided to just spray paint over the plate. It was not the screws that rusted but the plate where the screw goes through.
customer_reviews.author: Feltongirl

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I use it to move rain water from the 55 gal rain barrel below the downspouts to the barrels near my garden. All these many years I used a very small aquarium pump and the transfer took hours depending on the scope of the job. So, imagine being done in 23 minutes. It took me longer to get everything together and laid out in the small space I have. I doubt that I could find enough words of happiness and praise. I thoroughly recommend this product. I can't speak of the quietness because I have nothing to compare it to and probably wouldn't care.
customer_reviews.author: cdog

customer_reviews.title: Already worked great in a pinch
customer_reviews.text: While waiting for a busted underground drain pipe to be fixed, all rainwater is currently being sent straight underneath our foundation and out through the sump pump. It hasn't been a problem until this week, when a very heavy rainstorm hit and the high water alarm in our sump pit went off because our regular pump wasn't keeping up. I ran to the basement, ripped this portable pump out of the box, attached a water hose to it, ran the hose out the window, threw the pump in the sump pit and it worked like a charm. I was probably one minute away from having water everywhere. This pump is already worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Btak

customer_reviews.title: This thing sucks
customer_reviews.text: This little pump moves water fast. Didn't know how fast till I was cleaning it from removing muddy water that built up during a flash flood and placed it inside a 5 gallon bucket of clean water that took 1 second to empty the whole bucket. You attach a regular garden hose (that works fine) - but a 1-1/2" hose (that moves the water faster) is sold separately by Superior. WARNING: That extra hose does not fit. The adapters are wrong sizes. I made it work by going to Home Depot and buying some PVC fittings that work - but I find the hose is not flexible and hard to store.
customer_reviews.author: John mcdonald

customer_reviews.title: Works better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Is amazing!! We have it pumping water from swimming pool, and through a series of hoses, then back to the pool so we have our diy pool heater. The water has to travel from the bottom of the pool, to the top of a 12 foot shed, then back to the pool ....and the stream makes it back to the pool like a solid hose force. The one we got looks used cause it is dirty and the package was torn open then retaped back together, but it works great so we didn't worry about doing the exchange
customer_reviews.author: DavinaW

customer_reviews.title: continuous submersion is a no-no due to leakage into electrical parts
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these accumulated, all of which shorted out after water leaked into them where the cord goes in. All of them will work again if I take them all apart to dry them out, will work for a couple days before shorting out again. If submerged continually as in pumping pond water, they will only last a couple years at most. Probably they can be sealed permanently with silicone glue on the compression gaskets, probably, maybe. I think the gaskets rot. I just bought the fourth. They're inexpensive, they pump, they last a year or two.
customer_reviews.author: scottyfon

customer_reviews.title: Works, but not much power on the stream
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use with a huge rain cistern, to power the hose hopefully enough to rival city water pressure. The contractor who set up my rain cistern recommended it. I don't know if I got a defective one, but it is barely provides a stream. It is set up from a faucet at the top of the cistern, but I don't think that should matter if it is run on a pump. I think I get better water pressure just using a hose with no pump from the bottom of the cistern, when it is really full. Unless it is an issue with combining it with a fabric expandable hose - a bit disappointing how weak it is.
customer_reviews.author: seattlejanie

customer_reviews.title: Out the box and ready 2go!
customer_reviews.text: ****FYI this pump is submersible But it does not have a float switch... You plug in it is on...You unplug it is off.... Great use for quick back-up to avoid flooding or to drain a flood or pool!!!! Flood warning didnt think my sump pump could do the job by itself so I installed this one. Got my water hose screwed it on dropped it in the hole. Ran the hose out the window, make sure no kinks... then I plugged it in. What a life saver. No flooded basement!
customer_reviews.author: EG

customer_reviews.title: Great pump for pumping out an above ground pool.
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my liner in my pool this little pupy doesnt go fast but its steady. My 12 x 18 pool at about half level, whatever the pool pump couldnt get out had to be done with this little puppy. as not to cause horrific flooding of yard, I ran it for 3 hours a day for 3 days and got it down to 1 inch in pool , so I pulled the liner off and herded the water towards the pump and when I =was done I had to only lift 1 gallon of water out of the pool with the liner ... easy peesay. Even named the pump little man. but he is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: edreimann

customer_reviews.title: Pump failed after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: The pump worked fine for 2 years then it failed!!!!! I will call customer service to see if there is something that they can do under warranty and advise further. Update, i contact the company and they have replaced my pump with a new one with no questions!!! Very good customer service and company.
customer_reviews.author: xorio

customer_reviews.title: Used for tankless water heater descaling
customer_reviews.text: I got this to keep my tank less water heater up and running. After my family got a tank less water heater they never maintained it and after 3 years the unit broke down. It was a pricey mistake that I intend to keep from repeating. This is my 2nd year with it and it has been used 3 times. 2 times for my houses and once for my relative. I expect them to come borrow it again. I used a washing machine hose set, a clean 5 gallon bucket I have laying around, and 3 gallons of distilled white vinegar and followed some youtube tutorials on how to descale the machine.
customer_reviews.author: ImBZppl

customer_reviews.title: After carefully using only 5 times the seal busted. RETURNING
customer_reviews.text: I carefully used this and the seal busted while emptying a pool. I will be returning and they will send a new one but I'm worried the manufactures are using some cheap material for the seal. Bummer as this is the third time I've had this model. First one lasted three years, the second one the seal busted and they sent me this one. Then this one has the seal busted too. Wish me luck on #4.
customer_reviews.author: Granny Trish

customer_reviews.title: Affordable Mighty Little Pump
customer_reviews.text: Not too shabby for a pump from Amazon. The main reason for the purchase was to drain out the pool. We unfortunately used a garden hose to get the job done. It definitely took forever and should have opted for an attachment with a wider diameter. No big deal since this pump held its own for a solid week of non-stop use as we drained and filled the pool back up. It didn't die on us so that's a positive thing. I'm looking forward to having this pump do it all over again a few more times before needed another one.
customer_reviews.author: KrissyVibes

customer_reviews.title: Very good value
customer_reviews.text: purchased it to pump water out of a small duck pool. Skim out the pool before draining and the pump drains it quickly and quietly in about 3 minutes. Purchased the extra hose at a L arge home improvement store for a good savings on similar ones online. Overall - very good price and couldn't source one similar on a shelf nearby. Will probably be a good options should storms in fall knock out power and need to pump mom's basement. Highly recommended and good value for the $ compared to other options I researched. Can't speak to longevity as I've only had it a couple of months, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Dirk diggler

customer_reviews.title: sturdy product with small issue.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised and is of good quality. my recent run, i had it running for couple of hours and it kept working consistently. Took away a star as on my first use it started leaking oil after 40 minutes of use. Call the customer support and they said that it is possible that my units oil screw might have been a little loose so replacing with fresh oil and tightening the screw could fix it. sounds simple but it tool a while to replace oil as it get air locked and you need to let air out before pouring some more oil, which takes a lot of time.
customer_reviews.author: August J

customer_reviews.title: Very useful!!  Surprisingly quiet!
customer_reviews.text: This is FAR quieter than my previous transfer pump. I'm using it to empty out my backyard pond in preparation for Spring... Much better than the old one. Yes, it handles muddy water, and debris filled water that I have to deal with all the time. It's relatively quick, it's quiet, and it handles everything I've asked of it so far, and it's easy to use...Since I only need to use this a couple of times a year,it's exactly what I was looking for. DO THE RESEARCH FIRST - This is not perfect for every application, but it's great for what I need it for.
customer_reviews.author: Al Correa

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted and needed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to drain my pool. I wanted something submersible, light, easy and that would get the last small amounts of water from the bottom. I also had some debris such as twigs and leaves and need the pump to be able to work around that. All was true and at a very reasonable price. I own it for the same price a big box hardware store would have rented it for one day. I bought the hose  and adapter  All fit easily and well and I was on my way to pumping minutes after I opened it all up.
customer_reviews.author: J. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great pump!!
customer_reviews.text: So I’ve only used it one time so far. I drained my 1200 gallon swim spa in about 3 1/2 hours. I used the 3/4” garden hose attachment that was provided. I was surprised by how low it was able to drain the water. Truly 1/8” and I just got the rest with a wet/dry vac. CON: So I had to take 1 star away because attaching a 1 1/4” hose required extra adapters to be purchased. I was going to buy a larger hose but realized I would also have to build or buy the proper adapter. The pump itself is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: SZero

customer_reviews.title: small but strong pump!
customer_reviews.text: This 1/4 HP motor is a beast for small motor size. I used this pump to pump out low spots in my acre yard. It handled muddy water with no problems and I ran it for 6 to 8 hours with these conditions. Never had to clean out anything on the pump! If I had to guess I moved about 200 gallons of dirty water and most of this was not deeper than 2" of water. Used a 5 gallon bucket with eight 3/4" holes drilled out in rhe bottom...added a layer if aluminum window screen to bottom of bucket and then tossed in the pump on top of screen. Worked flawlessly and without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Abe

customer_reviews.title: Tankless water heater maintenance
customer_reviews.text: Used this to flush my tankless water heater. Got a 5 gallon food grade bucket, set this pump inside it and poured in 3 gallons of white vinegar. Connected the pump to water heater service valves with a retired set of washer machine hoses. 45 minutes later I had 3 gallons of green vinegar and a hot water heater that seemed to actually produce slightly hotter water than before. I live where the water is very soft, so I will do this every other year instead of yearly like many others with hard water should do.
customer_reviews.author: Northshore McLeod

customer_reviews.title: Power like crazy!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this today and got it today! Immediately unboxed it, attached to garden hose and plugged in.... and voila! It's been pumping ever since. I need to pump water out of my inground pool sure to heavy rains. The skimmer basket area was overflowing!. Water has gone down considerably in just a few minutes. This is an awesome piece of equipment. I chose this particular model after much online research this morning. It's sold by a lot of stores.... Varying in price from the low of $49 to up to $100!! If you need to remove some water, this is your baby! Just get it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Diane Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk. I am appalled to see all these 5 start reviews on this pump. Did not work.
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk. We plugged in the pump and it tripped the breaker on that line. I am sad to say, some of these products sold at Amazon are absolute garbage. Now we are seriously thinking about our future purchases at Amazon. We wasted time, the gentlemen who came to flush our tankless water heater said, it is piece of junk. Thoroughly disappointed and angry. We wasted a lot of time and money. Learned a good lesson to avoid these cheap junk. I will not even give a one start, but
customer_reviews.author: cougar

customer_reviews.title: Fixed my flood
customer_reviews.text: My backyard floods every time we have big rainstorms in the winter, thanks to my drains that are clogged with tree roots. This was a much better solution than dealing with standing water and using sand bags. Pumps a ton of water and the price was right. It's not super loud, either. So easy to use. I even. hooked it up to an Alexa smart plug outside so when I'm inside and it's raining and flooding I can just say "Alexa turn on the pump" and it goes to work!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Wow, love it
customer_reviews.text: Dirt-simple to operate, moves a ton of water very quickly. I got one to help with rain overflow in our swimming pool and also to to a fast drain when cleaning our large fountain. Cannot believe I've been on this planet this long and not owned one of these til now. Make sure to have (or get) a short piece (~25 ft) of garden house to direct the outflow, so you don't have to disconnect/reconnect your existing hoses when you want to use the sump device.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas F. Marks

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Pump!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 1/4 HP version of this pump, along with a couple of 4 foot stainless steel braided washing machine hoses, to use to flush the heat exchanger on our Rannai tankless water heater. These items, along with a 5 gallon bucket, and 4 gallons of white distilled vinegar, made the job easy. Now I only need to purchase the white vinegar once a year, for the required annual flushing of the water heater. This is a lot better than spending $200 plus for a plumber to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Todd C Blake

customer_reviews.title: Failed straight out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Bought pump Oct 7 to help drain pool cover in spring. My other pump (purchased at Sears) still work but electrical cord became suspect and it lasted 28 years. I decided to test this pump before stowing it away and was amazed at how quiet it was, until I realized it wasn't working. I checked extension cord and it was OK. The pump was submerged in about a foot of water but never started. Well, I guess I'll return and get something that is a little bit noisier.
customer_reviews.author: Mista B

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My pool had overflowed when I left the hose in and forgot for hours. I have a vinyl liner in my pool and as afraid if I swam water would get under the vinyl liner and cause problems with a floating bottom or wrinkles. I ordered this pump, it was here in 2 days. It came with a free hose adapter, I connected to hose and within 3 hours my pool was pumped to an adequate level. Super easy, super fast and worked great. I also drained my spa and cleaned it up as well.
customer_reviews.author: JoeSacramento

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these pumps I have purchased. The first pump lasted about two years. This pump I purchased on October 3 and it is now October 20 and it has quit running. I use this pump to circulate water in my aquaponics system. It is advertised as a continuous duty pump. I do not recommend this pump.
customer_reviews.author: Concerned Reader

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for draining last few gallons from my pool
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well for draining the last 20 - 30 gallons of water from my in-ground pool. I had a rise of about 7' and used a 75' hose and it still worked. It even picked up sand and silt. I would recommend this product for any use similar to mine. Can't comment on longevity. It got the job done and I packed away for the next time. Word of caution: the power cord is 10' long and I had to use an extension cord. Make absolutely sure the extension cord is secured so it does not fall into the water you are trying to pump. That would be bad.
customer_reviews.author: Steve-O

customer_reviews.title: This pump is downright awesome.
customer_reviews.text: (I've used it for 2 weeks now. Will update if it fails.) I needed a new sump pump in my basement because the one left by previous owners died. Went to replace that exact one and it was $180! I said no way, and did some research. Found this pump and figured I'd give a shot at a 1/3 of the price. Of course I had to go to my local hardware store and buy several adapters to fit it on the 1 1/2 pvc($10 roughly) it had for the old pump but it works flawlessly. I'd highly recommend trying this pump out. I usually dont give such praise for items unless it surpasses quality of a previously owned item.
customer_reviews.author: ReviewsFoReal

customer_reviews.title: Useful, Versatile, Easy To Set Up, Use And Store Little Submersible Pump
customer_reviews.text: I did some online research about small pumps...I checked the manufacturers reputations, pump design, build quality, features, warranties and customer feedback. Superior pumps are, after doing my homework...superior...and thus aptly named. I am more than satisfied with this pump in every way, even impressed with it. It is quiet (relative to other pumps this size I've run), it is reliable and it is powerful for it's size and it's power and distance ratings. I would highly recommend a Superior pump to anyone for any application.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Saxman

customer_reviews.title: perfect submersible for outdoor ditch draining
customer_reviews.text: needed this to drain my personal Mariana Trench in my front yard. 230' long electrical story I won't bore you with. this has been doing what was expected and drains the swamp quickly and effectively. it is quiet and doesn't clog easily if the dead leaves stay away. pumping up two feet and 40' away discharge. strong pump. after this use I will get a switch and keep it as backup for my two sump pumps in basement. water is always present when your house is 40' from a 12' wide stream that always is flowing and burbling.
customer_reviews.author: morinolessino

customer_reviews.title: Good price for a good pump
customer_reviews.text: I am using this pump to empty out a plastic tub in my basement that I use to wash out my paint brushes. I attached a short garden hose to the screw threads and emptied it into my raised sewer line, maybe 5 ft up. Works without too much noise, has a built-in filter screen on the bottom. My only “Gee, I wish ...” is an on/off switch. I plug it into a power strip with an on/off switch as a work around. Does not shut off when it has no more water to pump so you have to keep your eye on water level, you wouldn’t want it to run while dry for too long.
customer_reviews.author: Edward McDaniels

customer_reviews.title: Good pump, but not for outdoor sump pump
customer_reviews.text: Good pump, but not for outdoor sump pump. While this has great power, and I love it when it works, it keeps getting clogged by small debris. I use it in an outdoor sump that collects rainwater from the gutters. The water often has small bits of leaves and other debris, and these tend to get stuck in the thin openings in the plastic mesh that protects the rotor blade. This means water can't actually enter the blade chamber, so the pump stops working. I've recently removed the plastic mesh entirely, and it seems to work for now, but I'm sure it's only a matter of time before something larger jams the actual rotor blade.
customer_reviews.author: Randy P

customer_reviews.title: Worked great to empty kiddy pool
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised. I bought it to empty out kiddy pool, as I found it to be a hassle to try and drain it in one single spot. With the included hose attachement,I was able to hook up my garden hose to the pump and water part of my lawn while draining the pool. Only thing is that it takes as long to pump water out as it does to fill the pool. For some reason I thought it would be a bit faster, maybe if I would have bought the one with 1/4 horse power more.
customer_reviews.author: Johann

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I own two of these. I use them for everything - our swimming pool, hot tub, fish pond, even pumping cold water through a wood-fired water heater and then back into my pool. I have one for the fish pond and it gets clogged up from time to time, and then the other one is strictly for the pool and hot tub. The flow rate is awesome, and it really will suck up water down to about 1/8" deep. I'm thinking about buying another to use on our houseboat and make a water cannon. It will blast water from a standard hose about 8 feet, so there is no telling how far you could shoot with a smaller diameter hose.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: 1/4 hp good enough for 2000 gallon
customer_reviews.text: Worked exactly as intended to empty my 400+1600 gallon jacuzzi-swim spa. The included adapter for use with existing garden hose is convenient. Yes it will be slower to use a garden hose, but I only anticipate changing out the water no more than 2-3 times a year, so I like not having another item to store. Also, because the hose is limiting factor, didn't see need for higher power pump. Will update if durability is less than stellar.
customer_reviews.author: Mark KI

customer_reviews.title: This pump is the bomb!
customer_reviews.text: I put off buying this when I wish I wouldn't have. I emptied the pool the old fashion way with a garden hose but couldn't get the last few inches out and then leaves started to fall and my cover blew off. In less than 20 mins 2-3 inches of water gone! I feel there was less than 1/8 inch is only a few low sections of the pool and by the end of the day the pool bottom was dry.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: This works great!
customer_reviews.text: Thank you! I purchased this pump in 2016 and never used it. It was a Emergency backup in the event my Moms basement got water. This works great! As you can see the water was shooting out at full speed. Thank you for a quality device!
customer_reviews.author: anthony

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pump if it hadn't leaked out all of the oil.
customer_reviews.text: Pushes a ton of water, but very intermittent operation. I put it in my above ground pool to keep the water rotating. It causes all the trash in the pool to collect in the middle for easy cleaning. Went out to check my pool a few weeks ago, and the breaker was tripped, and there was a strange film of oil on the surface of the water. Yep, pump took a dump in my pool. Very difficult clean up process. Get what you pay for I guess. Very strong pump if it stays working. I'm sure with the high number of five star reviews, that 8, or 9 out of 10 pumps are still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Aldridge

customer_reviews.title: It's a great pump! I use it everyday.
customer_reviews.text: I built my own sink pump with this and so far it's working great. I have to manually turn it on and off but I'm thinking about adding a float. I heard built in float have issues so if I just install my own it's going to work better. Pumps pretty fast and I'm hoping it last a while with daily use. I'll update this when that day comes. Update... still working good and I use it every day a few times if not a lot. It's survived over 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Jesture

customer_reviews.title: Great for draining a hot tub!
customer_reviews.text: We got this pump to drain our 350 gallon/6 person hot tub. We've had to use it 4 times and it's been great each time. It took about 20 minutes or so to drain that much water. Hot tub is 2 stories up on our deck. We connected our regular hose to it and the hose had to go over our railing, then down to the ground to drain. No issue with the hose having to pump up before it drained back down. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen W.

customer_reviews.title: Lasted just long enough for refund to exp
customer_reviews.text: We read the reviews, and watched the videos talking about how great this pump is and how long it will last. How much better it is then other pumps. Well it stopped working 7 days after return exp. This is more annoying then anything at all. If it would have died 1 day before exp warranty or a few months after i would have felt better about it. But something that dies a week after! Means its junk. I will not buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Great for hot water heater descaler.
customer_reviews.text: Used it to descale a Renai hot water heater. Had to remove water heater inline filter so it could flow properly. This unscrews above the cold water inlet. It's so powerful that the filter slows it down causes it to overheat. Without the filter, it flows perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Maltesefalcon

customer_reviews.title: Good functional pump
customer_reviews.text: Worked exactly as described. I bought this pump to facilitate a flush of a tankless water heater. I ordered it because it was rated at 14 GPM at 10' (mine is only 4' to the inlet and outlets). I used it, and indeed everything went fine. I circulated the water (and after a full solution of vinegar as instructed in the water heater directions) continuously for over an hour. No hiccups, no mistakes. I'm completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Smitty

customer_reviews.title: Indestructible!
customer_reviews.text: Wish Amazon had a 6 star rating, because this pump earned it...frickin’ indestructible! Our crawl space flooded due to torrential rains. After pumping out over 40,000 gallons with a gas- powered semi-trash pump, I left this little dude in a muddy sump for a full month while the rains continued. It kept going steady the whole time, 30 gallons per minute without a hiccup. Even ran dry for periods of reduced flooding without overheating or frying the motor. Hands down the best $47 I ever spent on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: KSminibike

customer_reviews.title: Fast, efficient, mighty mite
customer_reviews.text: Has worked very well, exceeded my expectations. Have an outdoor man-made pond. Three water falls into a two basin pond with a rock bridge. Live in a wooded area, numerous pines over the pond so needles and other leaves in the pond. Drained the entire pond very rapidly, good pressure, good sized hose taking all it can. Pump from backyard to street. The pump did not plug due to the needles and dirt that naturally settles on the lowest points in the pond. Very, quickly drained. Have larger, stronger, higher capacity pumps and one larger now but this is smaller and better.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Tankless Water Heater Descalar
customer_reviews.text: I used this pump to descale my Rinnai tankless water heater via the service valves. The pump itself seems to be constructed well and all the hoses fit without any issues. I placed this pump under 2 gallons of 5% white vinegar and ran it for about 50 mins. Worked like a charm! After I finished, I submerged it in clean water and ran it for 10 mins to purge out any vinegar. It's not too loud and pumps out a good volume of water.
customer_reviews.author: Kav

customer_reviews.title: Needed a good utility pump to descale & flush my water heaters
customer_reviews.text: The good news is the 1/4hp is a solid, reliable pump. The bad news is it could use a few improvements before being a really good pump for this type of use. It pumps so much so fast my water heater doesn't drain fast enough so I had to keep unplugging it until I find an on/off power switch. Would have been better if this pump had an auto-stop and stopped pumping when dry or had an in-line power switch.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn D

customer_reviews.title: pumps well, not suited for above ground pool cover water removal
customer_reviews.text: it has good weight to it, but the base is quite narrow compared to a pump like the little giant, and it will tip over very easily and stop pumping effectively. Also, since its not automatic it will keep running dry after tipping over which isn't good. I found myself having to stay with the pump and hold it in place the whole time I was clearing the water off the cover. It does pump pretty fast, but it was still very annoying. Would be a great pump if you are using this to pump something more stable than a pool cove.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Schofer

customer_reviews.title: Great for price point . STRONG!
customer_reviews.text: Started draining my 25' above ground pool today around 1900hrs will post again when it's done and approx time it took to drain and if any complications are encountered along the way. Wish me luck! Update 24 hrs later the pool has maybe 8inches left to drain. I would confidently say to drain a 25' measuring 6' tall it takes about 28 hrs to fully drain. No issues with over heating or dying. Overall great pump for price.
customer_reviews.author: Daddys Profile

customer_reviews.title: Fast and quiet, and pumps to a very low level
customer_reviews.text: I use this to empty the most gorgeous birth pool in the country! ;-) It's about 200 gallons, takes about 6 years to fill (OK... maybe not quite!) but this pump empties it quickly and quietly while the family bond with their newborn without being disturbed by a noisy pump in the background. It also empties to a very low level of water, leaving me very little additional work to empty it completely.
customer_reviews.author: J Mac

customer_reviews.title: does what it should
customer_reviews.text: I use this to remove the rain water that builds up on my pool cover. it works great. since it does not have a float and I don't want to burn up the motor by running it dry and don't always have time to just stand there and watch it I get it running and before walking away I turn it off. it then works like a siphon. the water keeps draining without the pump being turned on. I come back the next day and it had drained most of the water off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice little pump
customer_reviews.text: Got this pump to drain my approximately 400 gallon hot tub. Plug and play, simple operation. My black water drain is in the front of my house so I needed to use a 100 ft garden hose. It typically takes me at least 6 hours to drain. It took me exactly 100 mins. It was nice to get the tub drained faster and refilled without wasting alot of time. I wish they advertised a big hose in the 100ft length, it would have emptied in no time. You can see the garden hose in the picture, it kept a great steady stream the whole time.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Great pump , Not stable  - - >
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement pump for Me and My old one would stand firm on the ground and pump. This one has a strong very quiet motor but they put ( 3 ) tiny leg posts on the bottom. With a heavy garden hose screwed into the top as You would use it every time I turn around the pump is laying on it's side not working. I stand it back up over and over. Very poor design on the bottom. I'm thinking of cutting those legs off.
customer_reviews.author: DENNIS B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pump for maintaining a tankless water heater.
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect pump for doing annual de-calcification of my home's tankless water heater. Just connect a common washing machine hose to this pump, drop it into a 5gal bucket with concentrated vinegar (or CLR descaler), connect it to the tankless's ports and let it run for an hour. Since it's required maintenance at least once a year, doing it yourself saves the $350 most plumbers charge.
customer_reviews.author: Mike-K

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job, Won't Last Forever
customer_reviews.text: I use it to drain water from my pool spring & fall. It does the job, but these types of pumps (1/4 HP thermoplastic, etc.) in general are not very durable when used for outdoor applications like this. I got three seasons out of this one (maybe ~15-20 uses?) and two seasons out of the prior one. You have to baby them, store them in a temperature-controlled place, and absolutely be sure they are fully drained after each use. And even then, don't expect more than, say, 50-100 hours before the motor and/or bearings die. If you expect more than that, you will need to buy a heavier duty product.
customer_reviews.author: Tom In Bucks County

customer_reviews.title: Rated this one 5 stars based on previous one that just died
customer_reviews.text: Placed my second order for this pump as my first one (cannot recall how many years ago tho at least five) died suddenly after working very well with no issues at any time. Received the second pump fast and tested it to empty a small swimming pool and it performed admirably well, just like the first. Price wise a fantastic purchase because it lasted so long and always worked well. Not sure why the first one died, probably as kept in sun those many years.
customer_reviews.author: Ameritocracy

customer_reviews.title: Price plus quality
customer_reviews.text: The first pump I got worked when it felt like it. I sent that one back the second one is working great. I’m using it as a pool cover pump. For years I bought “pool cover pumps” spend a lot of money and they only lasted 2 or 3 seasons. This pump was a third of the price I used to pay. Let’s see how long this pump will last. Even if I get one season out of it, it’s still cheaper than buying a pool cover pump.
customer_reviews.author: Witzend

customer_reviews.title: Inferior seals.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. They work for a few weeks or months and then start tripping the GFCI. I learned the hard way to turn it off before reaching into the pond to service it. The first one spilled all of its oil into the pond too. So it's neither properly oil sealed nor electrically sealed. When it works, it's fine. But it won't be for long. I'll try another brand this time around.
customer_reviews.author: Jules P

customer_reviews.title: Nailed it!
customer_reviews.text: Likes: -Inexpensive -Easy garden hose connection -Ease of use Dislike (very minor): -Slow Although slow, this pump did a great job of helping to winterize a 3500 gallon in-ground jacuzzi. I didn't mind that it took about 10 hours to complete. I just checked in on it every couple of hours. Renting a submersible pump would've been twice the amount and two trips to the rental center (pickup and drop off). Happy with purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Pump!!
customer_reviews.text: This pump is a workhorse. I highly recommend if you need to drain moderate jobs. I use it to drain the drain barrel from my washer. I connected it to a smart plug so I can turn it on/off when I need to. This can be full submerged, but there is no way to attach a suction hose for smaller areas. However, I knew that before I bought it, so that is on me. I love the build in screen filter.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Drained my above ground hot tub in 55 minutes!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 5 person Thermospa hot tub that is a real pain to drain. It requires unscrewing a side panel. Instead of fighting that every 4 months I decided to get a sump pump. This fit onto my standard garden hose. I put it in the lowest part of my hot tub, plugged it in and set a timer to see how long it would take. 55 min to drain my hot tub! Got the water level low enough that 1 bath towel will get the remainder of the water out. Fantastic product!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Carol

customer_reviews.title: Working very well
customer_reviews.text: The pump works fine. I'm using it for a "pond less" water feature for outdoor trains. My only complaint would be that the plumbing parts to convert it from the screw in fitting (1-1/4") to 1-1/2" ABS wasn't clear. It required a straight threaded section, short length of 1-1/4" PVC pipe and a rubber flexible clamp collar to make the transition. Was really hoping it would be a simple ABS threaded connector. The description isn't clear in the ad.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny L

product_meta.title: Superior Pump 91330 1/3 HP Thermoplastic Submersible Utility Pump with 10-Foot Cord
product_meta.description:
Size:1/3 HP| Style:ThermoplasticSuperior Pump builds pumps that are truly Built to Last and are 100 percent factory tested. Superior Pump uses quality components including solid copper motor windings, heavy duty stainless steel jacketed shaft seals, double o-ring seals on motor plate, and electronically controlled split capacitors. Superior Pump model 91330, 1/3 HP thermoplastic submersible utility pump with 10 foot power cord and ¾-inch garden hose adapter, will move water up to 2400 gallons per hour. Equipped with suction screen to filter out large debris and handles up to 1/8-inch solids with ease. Base of the pump is designed to fit the hub of a standard 6-inch floor drain. This pump is UL/CUL listed and CSA certified and backed by a 1 year warranty.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Superior Pump is a family owned and operated Pump Company specializing in residential / light commercial duty pumps. Headquartered in Minneapolis, Minnesota, Superior Pump was founded in 1999 after spending years in the pump industry dating back to the 70's, and with a plumbing background starting in St Paul Minnesota dating all the way back to 1885. Superior Pump adheres to our strong core family values, selling the absolute highest quality product possible. Known for building durable pumps, Superior Pump concentrates on quality throughout the engineering, manufacturing and testing processes. Quality products, strong warranties, excellent USA based customer service - Superior Pumps Built to Last!
feature_bullets: 1/3 HP Utility pump moves up to 2,400 gallons per hour; pump will lift water up to 25' of vertical height
1-1/4 inch NPT discharge for hight capacity pumping; includes 3/4 inch garden hose adapter
Removable suction screen and handles up to 1/8 inch solids
Superior Pumps are Built to Last, engineered with quality components and are 100% factory tested

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars11,246 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
